summary: In 2017, hurricanes knocked out Puerto Rico's electricity grid and caused an 11-month blackout—the longest in U.S. history. Efforts are underway to rebuild a more resilient grid. FEMA has worked with Puerto Rico to assess grid damage, estimate costs, and more. FEMA recently committed about $10 billion to fund grid recovery but has not approved any long-term grid projects or given local entities clear information...
title: Puerto Rico Electricity: FEMA and HUD Have Not Approved Long-Term Projects and Need to Implement Recommendations to Address Uncertainties and Enhance Resilience
